required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Magnetic Stimulation to Treat VT Storm
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controled Trial of Transcutaneous Magnetic Stimulation of the Stellate Ganglion to Treat Ventricular Tachycardia Storm

brief_summary.textblock:
Ventricular Tachycardia storm is a medical emergency characterized by three or more episodes of ventricular arrhythmia within 24 hours and associated with a significantly increased mortality and massive health resource utilization. Several therapies are utilized including sympathetic blockade (through deep sedation and beta blockers), antiarrhythmic drugs, implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) reprograming where applicable, and catheter ablation. Despite standard intervention, mortality rates remain high and additional therapeutic options are actively being investigated.
The overall objective of this proposal is to investigate whether transcutaneous magnetic stimulation designed to inhibit the left stellate ganglion can be used in this population. This is a single-center, randomized, sham-controlled trial to assess the efficacy of transcutaneous magnetic stimulation of the left stellate ganglion to treat patients with ventricular tachycardia storm.

primary_outcome.measure: Ventricular Tachycardia - Incidence of ventricular tachycardia on inpatient telemetry monitoring
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of ventricular tachycardia on inpatient telemetry monitoring

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardioversion - Incidence of ICD or external defibrillation following stimulation on device interrogation or telemetry
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of ICD or external defibrillation following stimulation on device interrogation or telemetry

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in ICD or pacemaker lead impedances
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following completion of the protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Change in lead impedance (unit: Ohms) on device interrogation

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in ICD or pacemaker lead thresholds
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following completion of the protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Change in lead thresholds (unit: mV) on device interrogation

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in ICD or pacemaker lead sensitivities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following completion of the protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Change in lead sensitivity (unit: mA) on device interrogation

secondary_outcome.measure: Local effect from stimulation - Incidence of local skin irritation or patient reported local discomfort on visual analog scale (1-10)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately following completion of the protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of local skin irritation or patient reported local discomfort on visual analog scale (1-10)

secondary_outcome.measure: Antiarrhythmic drugs used post stimulation - Incidence of antiarrhythmic drug use post stimulation per inpatient medical record
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 72 hours following completion of the protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of antiarrhythmic drug use post stimulation per inpatient medical record

arm_group.description: Patients will receive one hour of sham stimulation.
Patients will receive one hour of active magnetic stimulation to the left stellate ganglion.

intervention.description: Transcutaneous magnetic stimulation targeting the left stellate ganglion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- â‰¥ 3 episodes of VT in 24 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Implanted ventricular assist device
- Metal implanted in head or neck (except the mouth)
- Implanted medication pumps
- Cochlear implant
- Implanted brain stimulator
- Ocular implant
- History of malignancy in region of stimulation (neck)

facility.name: Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania
